intro: Microlicia ordinata, commonly known as the common microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in dense inflorescences. Microlicia ordinata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
